thread.title: Resort and Tour News: Hiking in Trinidad & Tobago; Snowmobiling in Wyoming
thread.title_full: Resort and Tour News: Hiking in Trinidad & Tobago; Snowmobiling in Wyoming - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Resort and Tour News: Hiking in Trinidad & Tobago; Snowmobiling in Wyoming
text:
IN AUSTRALIA, A NEW GOLF COURSE FROM GREG NORMAN
The well-known Australian golfer Greg Norman has designed a new golf course in his homeland open to nonmembers who lodge nearby. In Victoria’s wine-centric Yarra Valley, about an hour’s drive from Melbourne, the Eastern Golf Club will open 27 holes in view of the Dividing Range mountains when finished in mid-October. Already, several are open to play, and though the course is private, nonmembers staying at nearby resorts, including Yering Gorge Cottages, Chateau Yering and Stones in the Yarra Valley, have access to it. Room rates start at 299 Australian dollars ($220) and green fees begin at 95 dollars ($70), including a golf cart.
